channel.title: Portfolio website for Anna Plaschke
channel.description: Recent content on Portfolio website for Anna Plaschke

item.title: Alcohol Consumption by Country
item.description: Where Do People Drink The Most Beer, Wine and Spirits? Germans drink beer, Italians drink wine and in Russia they drink Vodka. These are only few examples of the stereotypes that exist when it comes to the drinking behavior in the different countries. But are they true? Is Germany really the country with the highest beer consumption per capita? And Italy the one with the highest wine consumption? Let’s find that out: With this project I want to to analyze how the consumption of alcohol of beer, wine and spirits varies by country.

item.title: Anna Plaschke
item.description: My biography My name is Anna Plaschke, I am 24 years old and I grew up in the German speaking region of Italy, South Tyrol. I went to the German speaking school Realgymnasium Bozen and did an exchange in the Italian counterpart-school, Liceo Scientifico Torricelli. I graduated with honours in Business, Economics and Social Sciences from Vienna University of Economics and Business and did an exchange semester in Hongkong.

item.title: Does School Enrollment and GDP per Capita Affect the Fertility Rate?
item.description: School entrollment, GDP per capita and fertiliy rate The purpose of this project is to analyze the relationship between school enrollment, GDP per capita and fertility rate by regions. Loading, inspecting and joining datasets Loading data The first step, is to load the data: I load the worldbank data from the package wbstats. Because I don’t need all the data I select the indicators I am interested in and filter by indicator, start- and end-date.

item.title: Does the HIV Rate Affect Life Expectancy?
item.description: HIV Rate and Life Expectancy The purpose of this project is to analyze the relationship between HIV rate and life expectancy by regions. Loading, inspecting and joining datasets Loading data The first step, is to load the data: I load the gapminder HIV data and life expectancy data using read_csv to convert the csv files. The worldbank data instead is loaded from a package wbstats. Because I don’t need all the data I select the indicators I am interested in and filter by indicator, start- and end-date.

item.title: How much Does it Cost to Sleep in Copenhagen?
item.description: AirBnB prices in Copenhagen The purpose of this report is to explore data on AirBnB listings in Copenhagen and understand the key drivers of price variability, specifically focused on the price for a 4-night stay for 2 guests. Before going into detail into my analyses showing the code, I will quickly summarize the problem, approach and findings of the project:

item.title: It is Getting Warm in Here!
item.description: Climate change and temperature anomalies The whole world is talking about climate change and global warming. Let’s look at the data from Combined Land-Surface Air and Sea-Surface Water Temperature Anomalies in the Northern Hemisphere at NASA’s Goddard Institute for Space Studies and analyze if the data confirms global warming. Loading, inspecting and selecting data Loading data As first step, I load the data with the function read_csv().

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.
